intro: Odostemon fremontii, commonly known as the Fremont's odostemon, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white or greenish flowers bloom in late spring. Odostemon fremontii is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
